unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has recently rolled out updated traffic regulations aimed at enhancing road safety and streamlining traffic flow across India. These changes, effective from 1st August 2024, emphasize stricter enforcement of existing rules and introduce new provisions for vehicle documentation and licensing.

These changes, effective from first August two thousand and twenty four, emphasize stricter enforcement of existing rules and introduce new provisions for vehicle documentation and licensing.

unnormalised: One key amendment focuses on mandatory helmet usage for all two-wheeler riders, including pillion riders, with fines of Rs. 2000 levied for non-compliance. The regulation also mandates reflective tape on all commercial vehicles for improved visibility at night, reducing the risk of accidents, especially on highways like the Mumbai-Pune Expressway.
